archimate:Device.name: Docking Stations (DS)
archimate:Device.documentation:
Intended Use:
• All laptops with docking stations
Specifications:
• Ports: o USB-A: 3 ports (USB 3.0+) o USB-C: 1 port (Laptop charging/data) o HDMI: 1–2 ports. In addition, DisplayPort – Some hospital monitors may use DisplayPort (DP) instead of HDMI. Having DP + HDMI provides more flexibility. • Power Delivery: USB-C Power Delivery (100W+ recommended) – Some higher-performance laptops require 100W–130W (e.g., Dell XPS, Lenovo ThinkPad P-series). Ensure compatibility with power-hungry devices. • Data Port: USB-C Data Port – An extra USB-C data port supports newer peripherals like external SSDs and docks for medical devices. • Hub Support: Dual USB-C Hub Support – If the hospital integrates medical imaging or multiple external devices, dual USB-C for high-speed data transfer can be useful. • Form Factor: Compact desktop footprint • Supported Displays: Dual monitors at Full HD (1920x1080) • Connectivity Compatibility: Windows laptops (general office-use) • Audio: Single headphone/mic jack • Network Interface: Multi-Gigabit Ethernet (, 2.5G or 10G)External Device Compatibility: Printers, external drives, keyboards, mouse • Protective Equipment: Cable locks, security clamps
